title: After School Project Partners

curriculum.subject: Social-Emotional Learning
learningObjectives: Students will practice including peers who need support
Students will demonstrate flexibility in group dynamics
Students will recognize the value of sharing knowledge

selObjectives: Practice including others who may feel left out
Recognize when peers need support and respond helpfully
Value sharing ideas and learning from others

caselCoverage.self-awareness: Recognizing your own ability to help others
caselCoverage.self-management: Balancing your own work with helping a peer
caselCoverage.relationship-skills: Collaborating and sharing ideas across groups
caselCoverage.responsible-decision-making: Choosing to include and support others

intro.text: You walk into Ms. Chen's classroom after school.
It's time to work on your science project about renewable energy.
The room is quieter than usual.
Only a few students are scattered at different tables.
Your project partner, Kai, is already setting up materials near the window.
You notice Elena sitting alone at a nearby table.
She has books and papers spread out in front of her.
Elena keeps glancing over at you and Kai.
The whiteboard shows that Devon, her partner, is absent today.

beats.text: You set your backpack down and start unpacking.
She walks over to your table.
"Hey, could I join you two today?" she asks.
"Devon's sick and I really need to get some work done."
Kai looks up from organizing the craft supplies.
He glances between you and Elena.

choices.text: Tell Elena she can definitely join your group for today
Suggest Elena work at the table next to yours so you can help each other
choices.illustrationHint: You pointing to the nearby table

choices.text: Ask Kai what he thinks about Elena working with you today
choices.illustrationHint: You turning to consult with Kai

beats.text: Elena pulls up a chair and starts explaining her project.
You realize her project is very similar to yours.
Both groups are building models about solar energy.
Kai starts comparing the two approaches.
He points out that Elena's group solved a problem you've been stuck on.

choices.text: Propose that both groups share their different solutions and techniques
Continue working on your own project while Elena works on hers nearby
choices.illustrationHint: You focusing on your own materials

beats.text: Ms. Chen walks over to check on everyone's progress.
She notices the solar panel components spread across both tables.
"How are the projects going?" she asks.
Elena explains she's been working with you and Kai today.
She mentions the science fair presentation is next Friday.

choices.text: Ask Ms. Chen if there's time to combine both projects into one presentation
choices.illustrationHint: You asking Ms. Chen an ambitious question

choices.text: Tell Ms. Chen about the techniques you've been sharing between projects
choices.illustrationHint: You explaining the collaboration to Ms. Chen

choices.text: Continue listening as Ms. Chen gives feedback on the current designs
choices.illustrationHint: You listening attentively to Ms. Chen

ending.text: Ms. Chen smiles and tells all three of you to keep up the excellent work.
She walks back to her desk.
Afternoon sunlight streams through the classroom windows.
You can hear other students heading home in the hallway.
You're curious to see how both projects will turn out for the science fair.
